member.summary: Represents options for local search.

member.summary: Creates new LocalSearchOptions using specified values.
member.param: The search string to match against the names of files in path.
Specifies if search should include sub folders.

member.summary: The search string to match against the names of folder in path. Default is "*".

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.LocalSearchOptions.FilePattern
member.summary: The search string to match against the names of files in path. Default is "*".

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.LocalSearchOptions.UseRegex
member.summary: Specifies if and use regex matching (e.g. @"^.*\.txt$) or file matching (e.g. "*.txt")

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.LocalSearchOptions.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Specifies if and is case sensitive or not.

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.LocalSearchOptions.Recursive
member.summary: Specifies if search should include sub folders. Default is .

member.name: T:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpHashType
member.summary:
Represents hash algorithm. You can use to compute or check hash of the file. You can use or
to compute or check hash of the file on FTP server.

member.summary: CRC32 hash type (FTP client uses XCRC command).

member.summary: MD5 hash type (FTP client uses XMD5 command).

member.name: F:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpHashType.SHA1
member.summary: SHA-1 hash type (FTP client uses XSHA1 command).

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Log.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether logging is enabled or disabled. The default is . You can observe the log on standard VS output or use collection to add your own listener. Logging uses named "Ftp.dll". Category name for log entries is also "Ftp.dll".

member.summary: Creates all the directories and subdirectories in a specified by the . Some servers implement this feature by default, in such case you can use method.
member.param: Pathname of the new remote folder.
member.returns: Absolute path of the newly created remote folder.

The pathname to rename the file or folder to.

member.name: M:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.GetFileSize(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the size of the specified remote file.
member.remarks: On some servers this command works on folders.
member.param: The path of the remote file.
member.returns: Size of the specified file in bytes.

member.name: M:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.GetFileModificationTime(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the modification date and time of the specified remote file. This method uses MDTM command, that may be NOT supported by the server.
member.remarks: On some servers this command works on folders.
member.param: The path of the remote file or folder.
member.returns: Modification date of the specified file or folder.

member.name: M:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.SetFileModificationTime(System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Sets the modification date and time of the specified remote file. This method uses MFTM or MDTM commands, that may be NOT supported by the server.
member.remarks: On some servers this command works on folders.
member.param: The path of the remote file or folder.
New last modification date of the specified file or folder.

The path of the local file.

member.returns: Name of the newly created unique file on the server.
member.remarks: Some servers support this command incorrectly (MS FTP).

member.remarks: Some servers support this command incorrectly (MS FTP).

member.returns: List containing files and folders.

member.name: M:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.KeepAliveDuringTransfer(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Sets the interval, at which a NOOP command is sent on the control conenction during a file transfer.
member.param: Specifies interval at which a NOOP command will be sent on the control conenction during transfer. indicates that no NOOP command should be sent.
member.remarks: Setting keep alive can be useful to prevent routers from prematurely closing the command channel while a long data transfer is taking place. It is generally not necessary to set a value less than 15 minutes (900 seconds). Not all FTP servers support receiving NOOP commands during file transfers. It's been observed that these servers will act strangely: not reply to the command, or only send the reply after the file transfer has completed. This will cause the component to throw a timeout exception since it's expecting a reply within the timeout period. If you see this behavior, consider not using this method.

member.name: E:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.Progress
member.summary: Reports progress of the current upload or download.

member.name: E:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.BatchProgress
member.summary: Reports progress of the current batch upload or download.

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.Mode
member.summary: FTP data connection mode: Active (client waits for incoming data connections) or Passive (client establishes data connections). Passive is default.
member.remarks: You can specifies ports to use in active mode by using property.

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.ActiveModePorts
member.summary: Gets or sets the port range used in mode. This has no effect for passive mode transfers.

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.ActiveModeAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the IP address announced to the FTP server when establishing an mode data transfer. Don't set this unless needed. By default, the value of this property is which means that the address of the network interface is used instead. This has no effect for passive mode transfers.

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.ActiveModeDisableLocalAddressFix
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if a workaround for FTP servers that announce private range IP addresses even though a public IP was used for control connection. By default, when such address is detected, an IP address announced by the server in response to PASV command used is overrode with control connection address. Default is .

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.Ftp.IgnorePassiveModeAddress
member.summary: Ignores address sent by sever for data connections in mode.

member.name: T:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse
member.summary: Represents server response to FTP command.

member.name: M:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.ToString
member.summary: Returns of this response.
member.returns: of this response

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.Code
member.summary: Gets response code.

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.Message
member.summary: Gets response message

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.IsPositive
member.summary: Returns if response was positive. (1xy, 2yz, 3xy)

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.IsPositivePreliminary
member.summary: Returns if the requested action has successfully started, but another reply is to be expected before the client issues another command. (1yz Positive Preliminary reply)

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.IsPositiveCompletion
member.summary: Returns if response was positive completion. (2yz)

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.IsPositiveIntermediate
member.summary: Returns if the requested action has been accepted, but more information is required. The client should send another command in reply. (3yz Positive Intermediate reply)

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.IsNegative
member.summary: Returns if the command failed, but it can be retried. (4yz Transient Negative reply)

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.IsNegativePermanently
member.summary: Returns if the command failed permanently. (5yz Permanent Negative reply)

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.Lines
member.summary: Gets lines returned by multi-line response.

member.name: P:Limilabs.FTP.Client.FtpResponse.EndLine
member.summary: Gets last line returned by multi-line response.
